data.title: Robert De Niro Accidentally-on-Purpose Announces He Recently Had a Seventh Child
data.meta_description: The actor was talking fatherhood ahead of his film About My Father’s debut when it came up.
data.text:
Update (May 10, 2023 at 10:00 a.m.): Robert De Niro knows what he’s doing when it comes to fatherhood.

Page Six asked the actor whether he was “surprised” to become a father again at 79, while he was at the premiere of his film About My Father on Tuesday night. “No,” he said. He was not surprised. “How you could not plan that kind of thing?”

The original article continues below.

It’s nice to have seven of something. Deadly sins. Days in a week. Dwarves who each have a single personality trait. When it comes to quantities of things, you can’t really do better than seven.

So how lucky is Robert De Niro that he recently welcomed his seventh child into the world? The news was revealed a bit off the cuff. In an interview with ET Canada, the topic of fatherhood rightfully arose. De Niro’s new movie is called About My Father, so reporter Brittnee Blair went to lob a softie, prefacing a question with, “I know you have six kids,” to which De Niro said, “Seven, actually. I just had a baby.”

This is news! He had been Bobby “Six Kids” De Niro to the wider public until this week. ET Canada followed up with his reps, who confirmed the recent birth but did not reveal who the mother is. Page Six and other outlets report that his girlfriend, Tiffany Chen, was recently showing.

De Niro, who is 79, had the other six kids with three women over the course of 35 years. His eldest is Drena, 51, whom De Niro adopted when he married her mother, Diahnne Abbott, in 1976. De Niro had Raphael, 46, with Abbott as well. He had twins Aaron and Julian, 27, with model-actor Toukie Smith, and then had two children with his second ex-wife, Grace Hightower: Elliot, 25, and Helen, 11.

Congrats to De Niro on helping to bring a new life into the world, and congrats to all of De Niro’s kids for finally having enough siblings to start a water polo team.

Sharon Stone Is Pro–Kevin Spacey, Anti–Men Asking Before They Kiss Her

In an interview with The Hollywood Reporter, the actor doubled down on her support of Spacey in the midst of an ongoing sexual misconduct trial and shared her thoughts on gender: “I think we should want men to flirt with us,” she said.
